snippet.title: RoboReel Portable Power Cord System
snippet.description: The RoboReel is one of the most advanced and manageable extension cords around, but this heavy-duty system comes with a heavy-duty price.

snippet.title: Musical glove could improve mobility after spinal cord injury
snippet.description: The wireless device is helping tetraplegic study participants learn songs on a keyboard while improving sensation in their hands.

snippet.title: Hoover Air Cordless
snippet.description: A full-size battery-powered upright vacuum? Yes, please.

snippet.title: Gory severed-heads wedding cake a cut above the rest
snippet.description: A tasty yet disturbing tribute to the vow of "till death do us part." Crave's Bonnie Burton talks with bride and cake designer Natalie Sideserf about her beheaded confection.

snippet.title: 'RiceWrist' retrains motor skills after spinal-cord injury
snippet.description: Rice University is having great success with its prototype robotic device that, as a wearable exoskeleton, mimics a patient's joints from shoulder to hand.

snippet.title: Scientists help paralyzed rats walk by 'waking up' spinal cords
snippet.description: A five-year study out of the University of Zurich and the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology demonstrates that a simple chemical cocktail can revive the "innate intelligence" of the spinal column in rats.

snippet.title: The Gtech AirRam ditches the cord (pictures)
snippet.description: A closer look at the Gtech AirRam.

snippet.title: Don't worry, your severed fingers won't unlock your iPhone 5S
snippet.description: Panic ensues when Apple announces its fingerprint scanner. However, a closer reading suggests that finger-chopping might not be so worthwhile for thieves.

snippet.title: Scientists beat pain with spinal chip
snippet.description: Australian researchers are readying to conduct human trials of a smart chip, which, when implanted in the spinal cord, measures and stops pain signals from traveling to the brain.

snippet.title: How to cut the Google cord
snippet.description: Even longtime users of Gmail, Google Drive, and Google search will find switching to competing services a painless and ultimately rewarding process.
